description: This course offers a sociological understanding of social issues in South Africa in the post-apartheid era, as shaped by historical conditions including slavery, colonization, and apartheid. Students learn about issues of racism and poverty and how they intersect with other lines of inequality and are shaped by culture, policies, and institutions including government, economy, and education. The course draws heavily on guest lecturers and site visits. Offered alternate years during January term. Prerequisite: One course in sociology or anthropology, or a related social science course approved by the instructor.
